name: Hotel Re!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel in february and was delighted but this time(August), we nearly regret it. We booked like a month ago, and on check in got only single bed instead of queen one; apparently only given on availability. The good thing is that eventhough it was was early, we got out room. .... A super tiny room, i think the 712 was the left over space but still need to fit in a room to maximise the hotel. The shower cubicle had curtain instead of door, just give you the impression of the those really really cheap hotel on the street, the shower head holder was broken and fixed by amateur with a rusty screw, but still not holding the shower head at all(they fixed it properly when complained tho), the curtain was useless. A huge lack of ammenities and since we stayed there before, we asked for them and the obvious reply, we do not provide this,(not sure if that was the training buzz word) to get rid of you.
reviews.title: Poor staff-great manager

So we had to rush to get something to eat off orchard and took a taxi to get to my medical appointment.

reviews.text: Hotel Re
reviews.title: Great place for Singapore stop. Great value!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Re! on the back on recommendations from other Tripadvisor reviews and I am glad I did. While the hotel was a little out of the centre of the city a regular shuttle bus was available and stopped at key locations around the city. In addition the outram is only a short walk although it is up hill on the way back to the hotel. Taxi's are inexpensive so getting around wasn't a problem. The room was very small but the hotel was very clean and the staff only to happy to help. All in all a good choice I thought and the free wifi a great bonus.
reviews.title: I would stay there again
Pleasantly surprised by Re
reviews.text: In Singapore, i would be skeptical about a hotel room that is less than 100USD within decent distance of MRT. Hotel Re is just that, however it is new; and the rooms were very clean; and the hotel staff is very friendly. The lobby is a bit trendy, and the rooms are colorful; so this may not be for everyone. But the cleanliness and comfort transcend all; and the location near chinatown and the MRT is unbeatable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those used to Western hotels, the room is smaller and suited for a dense city. The bathroom is also tight, but overall efficiently arranged. One tip for those seeking authentic food is to head out to the areas around the Chinatown MRT (not Outram Park) for various food stalls selling delicious food from fresh noodles to green mango salad. And also be sure to try the dessert place diagnol to McDonald's in Chinatown famous for their ice desserts. Trust me, you'll NEED it if not accustomed to the heat of SE Asia.
reviews.title: Not bad really....

description: As you step into Hotel Re!, a modern retro themed boutique hotel, you are lost in swirls of vivacious colours and psychedelic furnishings tempered with a sleek modern touch. With numerous themed boutique hotels in the metropolis, this 12-storey, 140-room boutique hotel is a wondrous surprise waiting to be discovered. All guestrooms in this boutique hotel are furnished with retro inspired furniture and complimented with ultra modern technologyfor that for that unique Hotel Re! touch. Each floor in this boutique hotel has its own colour theme and all the rooms on the floor resonates with the designated colour and décor. Glittery mosaic-tiled bathrooms in all rooms are the finishing flourish to our distinctive boutique hotel is offering. Situated at the base of Pearl's Hill, along Chin Swee Road, Hotel Re! encloses guests in a serene and and scenic environment whilst being just a stone’s throw away from attractions like Chinatown, Clarke Quay and the famous shopping district, Orchard Road. Major tourist attractions in the city are easily accessible from the hotel’s convenient location to allowing guests to move around the city at their own leisure pace.
